Weaker ETags makes HTTP caches stronger

HTTP ETags help cut bandwidth by sending along a tag that the server could use to validate the cached content.

Rails supports it out-of-the-box but issues ‚Äústrong‚Äù ETags, which has stronger cachability implications than Rails can guarantee.

Not anymore! In Rails 5, Rails now correctly issue ‚Äúweak‚Äù ETags ‚Äî matching Rack::ETag‚Äôs behavior.
